metadata.Title: CVE-2019-12929 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description: ** DISPUTED ** The QMP guest_exec command in QEMU 4.0.0 and earlier is prone to OS command injection, which allows the attacker to achieve code execution, denial of service, or information disclosure by sending a crafted QMP command to the listening server. Note: This has been disputed as a non-issue since QEMU's -qmp interface is meant to be used by trusted users. If one is able to access this interface via a tcp socket open to the internet, then it is an insecure configuration issue.

notes.Note: mdeslaur> marking as ignored as this is working as designed and should not be used by non-trusted users

criterions.comment: qemu: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
